did.unittitle: Brotherhood of Locomotive Firemen and Enginemen Memorabilia

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Brotherhood of Locomotive Firemen and Enginemen (BLF&E)

did.abstract: Brotherhood of Locomotive Firemen and Enginemen Memorabilia including badges, name plates, push pins, pens, license plates, posters, plaques, buttons and other miscellaneous items

defitem.label: Contact Information:
defitem.item: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives Martin P. Catherwood Library 227 Ives Hall Cornell University Ithaca, NY 14853 (607) 255-3183 kheel_center@cornell.edu http://www.ilr.cornell.edu/library/kheel-center

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Brotherhood of Locomotive Firemen was founded on December 1, 1873, at Port Jervis, New York, to provide mutual support for railroad firemen. The Brotherhood initially emphasized insurance, but by the late nineteenth century had branched out into labor-management relations.

At the turn of the century, the organization changed its name to the Brotherhood of Locomotive Firemen and Enginemen (BLFE) after permitting engineers to join its ranks. In 1969, the union merged with the Order of Railway Conductors and Brakemen, the Brotherhood of Railroad Trainmen, and the Switchmen's Union of North America to form the United Transportation Union.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Brotherhood of Locomotive Firemen and Enginemen Memorabilia #5141 MB. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related Collections: 5141: Brotherhood of Locomotive Firemen and Enginemen Records 5141 G: Brotherhood of Locomotive Firemen and Enginemen Graphics 5141 P: Brotherhood of Locomotive Firemen and Enginemen Photographs 5147: Brotherhood of Locomotive Engineers Records 5467: Brotherhood of Locomotive Firemen and Enginemen Local 807 (Auburn, NY) Records 5475: Brotherhood of Locomotive Firemen and Enginemen General Chairman, Boston and Maine Railroad Records 5611: Brotherhood of Locomotive Firemen and Enginemen Honorary Register of Disabled 5646: Brotherhood of Locomotive Firemen and Enginemen Additional Records 5869: Brotherhood of Locomotive Firemen and Enginemen Local 807 (Auburn, NY) Additional Records 6146 P: Brotherhood of Locomotive Firemen Photographs 6176: Brotherhood of Locomotive Firemen and Enginemen Additional Records

did.unittitle: Brotherhood of Locomotive Firemen and Enginemen: badges

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Badges - All three are two sided one side is green/red/white, and one is black "In Memoriam". All have lettering "Erie Lodge No.543, B. of L.F. & E., Jersey City, N.J." One is for "President".

did.unittitle: Brotherhood of Locomotive Firemen and Enginemen: stamps

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One stamp is of the signature of "Frank S. Columbus" the other is "From F.B. Boardman, Chairman, New York State Legislative Board, B. of L.F. and E."

did.unittitle: Stamp with man's profile depicted on it

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Metal stamp on a wooden block, the stamp depicts a man's profile. [Frank S. Columbus?]

did.unittitle: Gavel - Frank S. Columbus, F. B. Boardman

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wooden gavel used by both Frank S. Columbus and F.B. Boardman. See information sheet included with gavel. Gavel head is missing 1/4 of it, looks to be split off.

did.unittitle: Gavel - from Tenth Biennial convention

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gavel used to open the Tenth Biennial Convention of the Brotherhood of Locomotive Firemen. Meeting was called to order by Brother John J. Hannahan, Grand Master at Nine O'Clock A.M., September 10, 1906 in Milwaukee, Wisconsin.
